info.guardianproject.iocipher

Class VirtualFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.guardianproject.iocipher.VirtualFileSystem

  • public class VirtualFileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    A virtual file system container. Open and mount a virtual file system container backed by a SQLCipher database for full encrypted file storage.

      • setContainerPath

        public void setContainerPath(java.lang.String containerPath)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the path to the container file that is the virtual file system. This is specified as a String to avoid confusion between File and File.
        Parameters:
        {@code - containerPath} the physical disk file that serves as the VFS container
        Throws:
        {@link - IllegalArgumentException} if the containing directory does not exist or is not readable
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getContainerPath

        public java.lang.String getContainerPath()
        Get the full path to the file used as the virtual file system container.
        Returns:
        the path to the VFS container file

      • createNewContainer

        public void createNewContainer(java.lang.String password)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new VFS container file at the path given from setContainerPath(String) and password.

        If the container path was not set does not exist, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        {@code - password} the password to set in the new VFS container
        Throws:
        {@link - IllegalArgumentException}
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • deleteContainer

        public boolean deleteContainer()
        Delete all files associated with the container itself, i.e. the sqlfs database, the SQLite WAL log file, and the SQLite SHM file.
        Returns:
        true if all related files were deleted, false otherwise

      • deleteContainer

        public boolean deleteContainer(java.lang.String containerPath)
        Delete all files associated with the container itself, i.e. the sqlfs database, the SQLite WAL log file, and the SQLite SHM file.
        Parameters:
        containerPath - the path to the sqlfs database file
        Returns:
        true if all related files were deleted, false otherwise

      • mount

        public void mount(java.lang.String password)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Open and mount a virtual file system container encrypted with the provided password as a String. This String is then used to derive the AES key using SQLCipher's key derivation method. This method is the least preferred option because it is not possible to clear the password from memory since String instances are immutable.

        If the vfs is already mounted, it will throw an IllegalStateException. If the file does not exist or the password is wrong, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        password - the password to unlock the VFS container
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException, - IllegalStateException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • mount

        public void mount(java.lang.String containerPath,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Open and mount a virtual file system container encrypted with the provided password as a String. This String is then used to derive the AES key using SQLCipher's key derivation method. This method is the least preferred option because it is not possible to clear the password from memory since String instances are immutable.

        If the vfs is already mounted, it will throw an IllegalStateException. If the file does not exist or the password is wrong, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        containerPath - the path to the file to mount
        password - the password to unlock the VFS container
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException, - IllegalStateException

      • mount

        public void mount(byte[] key)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Open and mount a virtual file system container encrypted with the provided key. This expects the raw AES key as a SecretKey instance here to be passed directly to the underlying database layer. It is not a password that will then be used to derive a key, like with mount(String). This method only accepts raw byte values, if you need to send a Unicode string, use mount(String). Also, a byte[] can be zeroed out when it is no longer needed. This method and mount(SecretKey) were designed to be used with the CacheWord library.

        If the vfs is already mounted, it will throw an IllegalStateException. If the file does not exist or the key is wrong, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        {@code - key} the container's raw AES key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException, - IllegalStateException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • mount

        public void mount(java.lang.String containerPath,
                  byte[] key)
        Open and mount a virtual file system container encrypted with the provided key. This expects the raw AES key as a SecretKey instance here to be passed directly to the underlying database layer. It is not a password that will then be used to derive a key, like with mount(String). This method only accepts raw byte values, if you need to send a Unicode string, use mount(String). Also, a byte[] can be zeroed out when it is no longer needed. This method and mount(SecretKey) were designed to be used with the CacheWord library.

        If the vfs is already mounted, it will throw an IllegalStateException. If the file does not exist or the key is wrong, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        containerPath - the path to the file to mount
        {@code - key} the container's raw AES key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException, - IllegalStateException

      • mount

        public void mount(javax.crypto.SecretKey key)
        Open and mount a virtual file system container encrypted with the provided key. This expects the raw AES key as a SecretKey instance here to be passed directly to the underlying database layer. It is not a password that will then be used to derive a key, like with mount(String). This method and mount(byte[]) were designed to be used with the CacheWord library.

        If the vfs is already mounted, it will throw an IllegalStateException. If the file does not exist or the key is wrong, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException, - IllegalStateException

        public void mount(java.lang.String containerPath,
                  javax.crypto.SecretKey key)
        Open and mount a virtual file system container encrypted with the provided key. This expects the raw AES key as a SecretKey instance here to be passed directly to the underlying database layer. It is not a password that will then be used to derive a key, like with mount(String). This method and mount(byte[]) were designed to be used with the CacheWord library.

        Parameters:

        {@code - key} the container's raw AES key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException, - IllegalStateException

      • unmount

        public void unmount()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Unmount the file system. It will throw an IllegalStateException if the vfs is not mounted, or if it cannot be unmounted because it is busy (some threads are still active on it).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • isMounted

        public boolean isMounted()
        Returns:
        whether the VFS is mounted or not

      • detachThread

        public void detachThread()
        If accessing an IOCipher container in any thread separate from where mount(byte[]) was called, that thread will have its own IOCipher state. For threads that do not quit when complete or are reused, like Android's AsyncTask or any "thread pool" model, this method must be called when each thread is finished using the container. Otherwise, that thread will keep its connection to the container open, and it will not be possible to unmount() successfully.

      • beginTransaction

        public void beginTransaction()
        Call this function before performance sensitive write operations to increase performance

      • completeTransaction

        public void completeTransaction()
        Call this function after performance sensitive write operations complete
